messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 872
messages.msgSnippet: Well, don t know if my first reply went through or not, but for all those grammar, spelling, punctuation, etc. questions, the two bibles on any good
messages.messageBody:
Well, don't know if my first reply went through or not, but for all those
grammar, spelling, punctuation, etc. questions, the two "bibles" on any good
secretary's desk are "HOW" and "Gregg."

According to both you do not use upper case for listing chapter or verse,
etc.

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: <benliam@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, November 22, 2000 7:05 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 872


> In a message dated 11/22/00 1:04:43 PM Eastern Standard Time,
> Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:
>
> << "In Chapter 13 the
> character...." Is the word chapter capped? >>
>
> I would say no, the word chapter would not be capped.
> But i am not a syntax wizard.
>
> cath
